conclusion: Initial position of light source causes shadows to be directed towards the viewer.
Moving the light source forward affects both the length and direction of shadows.
Shadows will shift closer to the objects as the light source moves closer.
Shadows will become shorter due to the light hitting objects at a more vertical angle.
Shadows decrease in size as the light source moves forward.
Shadow A (Cake) moves closer to the cake and becomes shorter.
Shadow B (Calendar) moves closer to the calendar and becomes shorter.
Shadow C (Carton) moves closer to the carton and becomes shorter.
Shadow D (Ball) moves closer to the ball and becomes shorter.
All shadows will be positioned closer to their respective objects and appear smaller.
Final answer: Shadows A, B, C, and D shift closer to objects and become shorter.
